title: YPG International
text:
The YPG International or People's Protection Units International (<a href="Kurdish%20languages">Kurdish</a>: "YPG Enternasyonel") is a military unit made up of <a href="Syrian%20Democratic%20Forces">foreign fighters in the Syrian Democratic Forces</a>. It was created in December 2016 as the Antifascist International Tabûr (AIT) of the <a href="People%27s%20Protection%20Units">People's Protection Units</a> (YPG). The unit is part of the <a href="Syrian%20Democratic%20Forces">Syrian Democratic Forces</a> in the <a href="Syrian%20Civil%20War">Syrian Civil War</a>.
Establishment and campaigns.
The brigade was founded in December 2016, and elected as its first commander the Italian-Moroccan Karim Marcello Franceschi. The battalion emerged from a proposal for foreign fighters to serve in an English-speaking unit, as opposed to the <a href="International%20Freedom%20Battalion">International Freedom Battalion</a>, where the predominant language is Turkish.
The unit is composed mostly of people from <a href="Western%20Europe">Western Europe</a>, including <a href="communists">communists</a>, <a href="socialists">socialists</a> and <a href="anarchists">anarchists</a>. The unit's initial statement mentioned their principles and causes, highlighting the common unity between communists and anarchists as an <a href="anti-fascist">anti-fascist</a> front against the <a href="Islamic%20State%20of%20Iraq%20and%20the%20Levant">Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant</a>. The statement was released in several languages, including <a href="English%20language">English</a>, Italian, Spanish and <a href="Basque%20language">Basque</a>.
The unit took part in the 2016 <a href="Manbij%20offensive">Manbij offensive</a>, the <a href="Raqqa%20campaign%20%282016-2017%29">Raqqa campaign (2016-2017)</a>, the <a href="Deir%20ez-Zor%20campaign%20%282017-19%29">Deir ez-Zor campaign (2017-19)</a>, and the resistance to the 2018 <a href="Turkish%20invasion%20of%20Afrin">Turkish invasion of Afrin</a> and the <a href="2019%20Turkish%20offensive%20into%20northeastern%20Syria">2019 Turkish offensive into northeastern Syria</a>.
